text: Does HubSpot support webp images?
in the best possible way

ALL images that are not vector, HS converts to webp automatically if the user’s web browser supports webp.

If the web browser doesn’t support WebP, they get the format that was originally uploaded.

You do not need to upload webp images to the filemanager, and actually that would be a bad thing to do as you would lose the fallback functionality HS gives you for free.

The part that may  confuse you is how HubSpot actually does this, the file name will not change to .webp it will still say .png or .jpg but the server actually delivers the webp. you’ll notice this if you try to download an image on HS that has the query parameters added to it
Oh brilliant! Thanks for this Jon
What are the query parameters Jon???
are there specific ones for webp??
Does anyone know why some Forms render in an iframe, and others don't?
check the form’s settings. there’s an option in the form editor for some form themes now, using the themes results in an iframe.
There’s a toggle to turn it off for a specific form forgot where exactly it is, but I remember it’s toward the bottom and it’s not completely obvious
got it!

<https://designers.HubSpot.com/en/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-functions#resize-image-url>
If you use this function, it will add the query parameters. It will also do this too if you have a width attribute on the image(not width in css) This will automatically append the query parameters
Options > Unstyled form
THANKS!
.../bonus the other Jon 1 pint
Us Jon’s are pretty great, lol
Jon = Lifesaver! :heart:
That is interesting... <@UCSKU31SA> any thoughts? Looks to be related to <https://crowdvocate.com/>

Hi all, new guy here.  Got a quick question:  I'm doing the CMS Developer Practicum and it's saying "Three files are required".  My question is, can I ONLY have these three files, or are those just the minimum files that I need?  Many thanks in advance.
<@U3PKJ8EQL> Can you comment on this?
Hi <@UKWPUPJ4W>, just minimum. You can break it out however you'd like. It just needs to include at least a template, module, and css file.
Awesome, thank you so much!
NP. Also if you have any other questions, feel free to DM me even if it's just commentary on stuff that seems unclear. Always trying to evolve this thing.
Appreciate that greatly.  I just realized you're the instructor from the videos I've been watching - you're Internet famous!  :wink:
Gotcha. I’m trying to do this within an existing custom module. Maybe it’s not possible.

Hey, I can't find on how to make a custom search bar to only search on the same page which is a page I'm building called FAQ. Is there a way to add code or edit the search results to find only on one page?
If you’re trying to search just the page you’re on you’ll want javascript based search to jump you to the section of the page, NOT hubSpot’s search
How does this work for PageSpeed test then? I run a HubSpot page through it and it does not detect the new format, just shows .jpeg or .png, but if I upload and use a .webp image it does detect it.
google pagespeed insights is not clever enough to detect it. Some other tools do detect it though. This is just something to explain to clients
Is there a way to see it with an inspector then, as I also see the original format in the page source code.
I think if you go to network tab and you look at the images it shows the actual format in the headers or something
Got it! Now I see the types. Do they do any kind of lazy loading?
not by default but now days it’s crazy easy with the native lazyload n whatnot
True. The only area I am having issues with lazy loading is on galleries.
for the redirect for naked domains with ssl what are people telling their clients to use: NakedSSL, EasyRedir or something else?

I personally like EasyRedir because they have great customer service and use multiple IP addresses (in case one goes down for whatever reason). If a customer that I'm working with needs a free solution, I usually recommend NakedSSL in that case. Overall both of these have worked really well. There is another that I've seen recently (<https://redirect.pizza/>) but I haven't had a chance to play around with that one yet.
great name!
(we use easyredir) it has been a great solution

Ok so I got a good questions here, we have client who we added a domain to their portal, they then had the two system domains and their third domain, somehow, on of the system domains got connected as a redirect and now when removed, they arent able to see the 2nd system domain anymore
is there anyone from HS who might be able to help me out and take a peek?
Really dumb question - but is the Display System Domains toggled on in Advanced options?
totally not dumb, it is def toggled on, but the kicker is it isnt even showing them now
this is what it looks like now
Yeah, that seems like a HubSpot glitch. Almost like it disconnected it automatically
Yea that was my thought cause in our own portal when I look at system domains, they are there listed
just this clients

I'm using an include to include a template that contains the `standard_hearder_includes`. However, I'm getting an error in design manager that says my template that uses the include doesn't have the `standard_header_includes` tag. I'm using the same include line on other templates and only get a complaint on this one.
I've also never had a complaint on this template despite it being used for the last year now.
Any one else have this issue in the past or now and can help me out?

Here's the include line:
```{% include 'Coded files/Custom/system/global/header.html' %}```

on that same template I have a choice tag
```{% choice "include_menu" label="Does This Page Have Side Navigation?", value="yes", choices="yes,no", export_to_template_context=True %}```
Then just a few lines down I have an if statement using the value of that choice
```{% if widget_data.include_menu.value == "yes" %}```
However, design manager is giving me an error on that line `InterpretException: Error rendering tag`

it's like it's gone bonkers on this one template.
what do you mean js based search? was thinking json but idk how to implement it in HubSpot. is there an example or article i can read?
Bit of an emergency here... I'm working to get a new design live and the editor in Marketing->Files and Templates->Design Tools is basically WSODing on me...
It loads and then switches to a blank page (w/ the menu bar)
